intro: Pseudosabicea mildbraedii, commonly known as the Natal flatbush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, low-growing habit with opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
